citations.title: Pattern Recognition and Machine Learning (Bishop, 2006). Rigorous probability-first ML; Chapter 1–3, 4–5, 7–9 cover most foundations.
Probabilistic ML (Murphy). Start with the classic ML: a Probabilistic Perspective for principled models and inference.  and https://www.cs.ubc.ca/~murphyk/MLbook/
Probabilistic ML (Murphy). Start with the classic ML: a Probabilistic Perspective for principled models and inference. https://probml.github.io/pml-book/book1.html and
Read papers efficiently (3-pass method) to avoid chasing hype: Keshav, “How to Read a Paper.”
Watch for systems pitfalls: Sculley et al., “Hidden Technical Debt in ML Systems.”
Deep Learning (Goodfellow, Bengio, Courville). Chapters on optimization, regularization, convnets, sequence modeling.
Use the NeurIPS Reproducibility Checklist (v2.0) as your lab checklist for runs, seeds, metrics, and code release.
Create a Model Card for each trained model (Mitchell et al., 2019).
Transformer: Vaswani et al., “Attention Is All You Need” (2017).
BERT: Devlin et al. (2019).
GPT-3: Brown et al., “Language Models are Few-Shot Learners” (2020).
Compute-optimal scaling: Hoffmann et al., “Chinchilla” (2022).
Efficient fine-tuning: Hu et al., “LoRA” (2021).
Retrieval-augmented generation: Lewis et al. (2020).
Instruction following/RLHF: Ouyang et al., “InstructGPT” (2022).
Jurafsky & Martin, Speech and Language Processing (3rd ed. draft).
HELM: Holistic Evaluation of Language Models (Stanford CRFM).
GLUE/SuperGLUE for NLU. GLUE:  SuperGLUE: https://arxiv.org/abs/1905.00537
GLUE/SuperGLUE for NLU. GLUE: https://arxiv.org/abs/1804.07461; SuperGLUE:
MMLU (broad knowledge).
TruthfulQA (misinformation/hallucination stress test).
Datasheets for Datasets (Gebru et al.).
Data Statements for NLP (Bender & Friedman).
NIST AI Risk Management Framework 1.0 (functions/govern, map, measure, manage).
OECD AI Principles (trustworthy AI, accountability).
EU AI Act (overview of risk tiers and obligations).
Use evaluation-first views: HELM dashboards and leaderboard papers to contextualize claims.
Track code and replications: Papers with Code (or its GitHub mirror).
Follow sober lab blogs: BAIR blog (method-focused).
Expected outcome: RAG improves factuality on knowledge-intensive queries (Lewis et al., 2020) and may reduce falsehoods on some TruthfulQA categories.  https://arxiv.org/abs/2109.07958
Murphy. Probabilistic ML / ML: a Probabilistic Perspective.  https://www.cs.ubc.ca/~murphyk/MLbook/
Sutton & Barto. Reinforcement Learning (2e).
